comments:
Per discussion with Richard. In some cases, the workbench will hang when 
creating a new WSDL file. To reproduce:

1. Start with a new workspace
2. Create a Tomcat 5.0.2.8 targetted J2EE Web module. Use the same name for 
your project and module (not sure whether this will make any difference).
3. Make sure you switch to the J2EE perspective when prompted.
4. Launch the new WSDL wizard to create a new WSDL file (default settings)
5. Eclipse hangs...

Here's the trace. Richard, I'm opening this bug against the wst.wsdl component 
since this is where the bug was found. Re-assign if neccessary, thanks.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.wsdl 2 0 2005-04-21 18:27:32.189
!MESSAGE Document root element is missing.

I would change this bug's priority to 2 (but bugzilla wouldn't allow me) given 
that user has no way out beside killing the workbench. However, I wouldn't 
consider this a blocker just yet because there's an easy workaround, which is 
to avoid the J2EE perspective before creating the WSDL file.

We're seeing a problem when we attempt to import a wsil or wsdl file in the 
J2EE perspective.
It appears we're hitting an infinite loop in CommonWorkingSetViewer.java in 
method remove(Object[] elements).  Line 192

We're also hitting this infinite loop when finishing the New WSDL Wizard.

I'm using the I20050419 and I20050421 Integration driver.

The defect was fixed on 04/25 round 5:00 pm yesterday. I verified on the
yesterday's 04/24  nightly build.
